name.richardson.james.bukkit.utilities.plugin
Class SimplePlugin

java.lang.Object
  org.bukkit.plugin.PluginBase
      org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
          name.richardson.james.bukkit.utilities.plugin.SimplePlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
PermissionsHolder, Debuggable, Localisable, org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
public abstract class SimplePlugin
extends org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
implements Debuggable, Localisable, PermissionsHolder

This class provides a basic implementation of the Debuggable, Localisable and Permissions interface for a standard plugin. It is provided as a convenience to avoid duplicating the same code across numerous plugins.

getMessage

public String getMessage(String key)
Description copied from interface: Localisable
Gets a localised message by providing a message key. This returns a string from the ResourceBundle, providing that it exists. This method does not do any additional formatting beyond returning the localised message.

Specified by:
getMessage in interface Localisable
Parameters:
key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
Returns:
The localised message matching the key supplied.

getSimpleFormattedMessage

public String getSimpleFormattedMessage(String key,
                                        Object[] arguments)
Description copied from interface: Localisable
Gets the simple formatted message. This method returns a localised message replacing place holders in the string with the arguments provided.

Specified by:
getSimpleFormattedMessage in interface Localisable
Parameters:
key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
arguments - The arguments to use to format the message and replace the place holders.
Returns:
The localised message matching the key supplied and with the placeholders replaced.

getSimpleFormattedMessage

public String getSimpleFormattedMessage(String key,
                                        String argument)
Description copied from interface: Localisable
Gets the simple formatted message. This method returns a localised message replacing place holder in the string with the argument provided. It is a convenience method to avoid creating an array of a single String.

Specified by:
getSimpleFormattedMessage in interface Localisable
Parameters:
key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
argument - The argument to use to format the message and replace the place holder.
Returns:
The localised message matching the key supplied and with the placeholder replaced.

getChoiceFormattedMessage

public String getChoiceFormattedMessage(String key,
                                        Object[] arguments,
                                        String[] formats,
                                        double[] limits)
Description copied from interface: Localisable
Gets the choice formatted message. This method returns a localised message replacing place holder in the string with the arguments provided. Additionally it alters the formatting of the message depending on the formats and limits provided. This can return messages such as "1 ban" or "2 bans".

Specified by:
getChoiceFormattedMessage in interface Localisable
Parameters:
key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
formats - The formats to use when matched to a limit. For example {"no bans", "one ban"}.
limits - The limits as Doubles. For example {0,1}.
Returns:
The localised message matching the key supplied and with the placeholder replaced.

getResourceBundleOverride

private FileInputStream getResourceBundleOverride(String path)

setLoggerPrefix

protected void setLoggerPrefix()
Sets the prefix of the console logger based on the name of the plugin. For example if the name of the plugin is 'BanHammer' the resulting prefix will be '[BanHammer] '.

setResourceBundle

protected void setResourceBundle()
                          throws IOException
Sets the resource bundle for this plugin. It first attempts to check if the user has created their own localisation.properties file in the plugin's datafolder. If they have it load those strings and ignore the built in ResourceBundles. If no override exists it will search for an appropriate ResourceBundle in the plugin.jar in the usual way.

Throws:
IOException

setRootPermission

protected void setRootPermission()
Sets the root permission for this object. The root permission is the parent permission that all permissions associated to this object should share. This is automatically determined based on the name of the plugin.
